SEARCH
Package oop.project.cli

Class ArgumentParser

java.lang.Object
oop.project.cli.Parser
oop.project.cli.ArgumentParser
public class ArgumentParser extends Parser
ArgumentParser is a utility class designed to parse and handle command-line arguments for applications. It supports both positional arguments and named flags, as well as sub-commands with their own sets of arguments. It also provides functionality to print help messages based on the defined arguments and commands, and can validate argument values using custom validation functions.

  • Field Details

    • commands

      protected Map<String,Command> commands

  • Constructor Details

    • ArgumentParser

      public ArgumentParser(String name, String identifier)
      Constructs a basic ArgumentParser with the specified name and identifier. This constructor delegates to the superclass Parser for basic initialization.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the program or utility that this ArgumentParser instance is for.
      identifier - A unique identifier used in the command-line invocation of this program or utility.

    • ArgumentParser

      public ArgumentParser(String name, String identifier, String description)
      Constructs an ArgumentParser with a name, identifier, and description. This constructor delegates to the superclass Parser to include a description in the initialization process.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the program.
      identifier - The command-line identifier for the program.
      description - A description of what the program or utility does.

  • Method Details

    • addCommand

      public void addCommand(Command command)
      Adds a Command object to the parser. If a command with the same name already exists, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown to avoid command name conflicts.
      Parameters:
      command - The Command object to add to the parser.

    • printHelpMessage

      public void printHelpMessage()
      Prints all the arguments and commands attached to this Command object. The message is formatted and displays information about the Command including its description, usage syntax, arguments, and optional arguments.

    • getParsedCommandArgument

      public Object getParsedCommandArgument(String command, String name)
      Getter for a specific argument in a command.
      Parameters:
      command - The identifier of the command to retrieve the command from the map of Commands.
      name - The name of the Argument to retreive from the command's map of arguments.
      Returns:
      The parsed value of the command line argument that is stored in the Command object.

    • getParsedCommandArguments

      public Map<String,Object> getParsedCommandArguments(String command)
      Getter for all the parsed arguments in a Command.
      Parameters:
      command - String representation of the unique identifier of the Command for retrieval in the map.
      Returns:
      A map parsed Commands where the keys are the command's unique identifier.

    • parseArgs

      public void parseArgs(String input) throws Exception
      Parses the input string to handle different types of command arguments or flags. This method tokenizes the input based on spaces, validates,then routes the command processing based on the type of argument or command detected.
      Parameters:
      input - The raw input string containing the command and its arguments.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the first token does not match the expected command identifier, indicating that the input is not intended for this parser, or if any other parsing error occurs.
